Instrument.name: Mars 2020 Perseverance Rover Entry, Descent, and Landing Camera Suite
Instrument.description: The Mars 2020 Perseverance Rover Entry, Descent, and Landing Camera Suite (EDL) contains a complement of camera systems to acquire visual data for the EDL phase of the Mars 2020 mission. It is comprised of seven (7) commercially-available IR cameras pointed at various components of the vehicle during EDL. These components are: (1) PUC: Parachute Uplook Camera (3 cameras, mounted on the backshell, looking upward at parachute deployment and inflation), (2) DDC: Descent Stage Downlook Camera (mounted on the descent stage, looking downward as the rover was lowered during the skycrane maneuver), (3) RUC: Rover Uplook Camera (mounted on the rover deck, looking upward at the descent stage during the skycrane maneuver and descent stage separation), (4) RDC: Rover Downlook Camera (mounted beneath the rover, looking downward at the surface). The EDL Camera Suite also contains an omnidirectional microphone capsule for capturing sound during EDL.
